main event: A sighting of a round, yellow-white object with a fuzzy outline occurred on July 2, 1958, between Springfield and Enon, Ohio.
interesting points: The object moved from 235 degrees azimuth to 265 degrees azimuth,The observer described the object as much too fast for an aircraft,The object was concluded to be a slow meteor by the investigator,The sighting lasted approximately 6 seconds and occurred at 0345 AM,The observer reported it while driving home from work.
witness description: A civilian observer, driving south on the highway.
